objectives.name: Assassinate
objectives.description:
[i]End Game Objective[/i]
Score 3 victory points at the end of the battle for each enemy ᴄʜᴀʀᴀᴄᴛᴇʀ model that is destroyed.

objectives.name: Bring it Down
objectives.description:
[i]End Game Objective[/i]
Score 2 victory points at the end of the battle for each enemy ᴍᴏɴsᴛᴇʀ or ᴠᴇʜɪᴄʟᴇ model with a Wounds characteristic of 10 or less that is destroyed, and 2 victory points for each enemy ᴍᴏɴsᴛᴇʀ or ᴠᴇʜɪᴄʟᴇ model with a Wounds characteristic of 11 or more that is destroyed.

objectives.name: Titan Slayers
objectives.description:
[i]End Game Objective[/i]
Score 10 victory points at the end of the battle if one enemy ᴛɪᴛᴀɴɪᴄ model is destroyed, or 15 victory points if two or more enemy ᴛɪᴛᴀɴɪᴄ models are destroyed.

objectives.name: Slay the Warlord
objectives.description:
[i]End Game Objective[/i]
Score 6 victory points at the end of the battle if the enemy ᴡᴀʀʟᴏʀᴅ is destroyed.

objectives.name: Thin Their Ranks
objectives.description:
[i]End Game Objective[/i]
If you select this objective, keep a tally of kill points; each time an enemy model is destroyed, add 1 to this tally (add 10 to this tally instead if the model that was destroyed had a Wounds characteristic of 10 or more). A model can, if it is resurrected for any reason (i.e. it was destroyed and subsequently returned to the battlefield), potentially add several points to this tally (assuming it is resurrected and destroyed several times over). At the end of the battle, divide your kill points tally by 10 and round down - the result is the number of victory points you score.

objectives.name: Attrition
objectives.description:
[i]Progressive Objective[/i]
Score 4 victory points at the end of the battle round if more enemy units than friendly units were destroyed this battle round.

objectives.name: While We Stand, We Fight
objectives.description:
[i]End Game Objective[/i]
If you select this objective, then before the battle you must identify which three models from your army (excluding models with the fortification battlefield role) have the highest points value, and make a note of them on your army roster (if two or more models are tied, you can choose between them). If your army has three or fewer models, then you instead identify all the units in your army. A model’s points cost includes the points of all weapons and wargear it is equipped with. You score 5 victory points for each of the models that are on the battlefield at the end of the battle.

objectives.name: First Strike
objectives.description:
[i]End Game Objective[/i]
Score 5 victory points at the end of the battle if any enemy units were destroyed in the first battle round, and score an additional 3 victory points if more enemy units than friendly units were destroyed in the first battle round.

objectives.name: Engage on All Fronts
objectives.description:
[i]Progressive Objective[/i]
Score 2 victory points at the end of your turn if you have one or more units from your army wholly within three different table quarters, and those units are all more than 6” from the centre of the battlefield. Score 3 victory points instead if you have one or more units from your army wholly within each table quarter, and those units are all more than 6” from the centre of the battlefield.

objectives.name: Linebreaker
objectives.description:
[i]Progressive Objective[/i]
Score 4 victory points at the end of your turn if two or more units from your army (excluding ᴀɪʀᴄʀᴀғᴛ)are wholly within your opponent’s deployment zone.

objectives.name: Domination
objectives.description:
[i]Progressive Objective[/i]
Score 3 victory points if you control more than half the total number of objective markers on the battlefield at the end of your turn.

objectives.name: Investigate Sites
objectives.description:
[i]Progressive Objective[/i]
Score 3 victory points each time a unit from your army successfully completes the following action: [b]Investigate Site (Action):[/b] One ɪɴғᴀɴᴛʀʏ unit (excluding ᴄʜᴀʀᴀᴄᴛᴇʀS) from your army can start to perform this action at the end of your Movement phase if it is within 6” of the centre of the battlefield and no enemy units (excluding ᴀɪʀᴄʀᴀғᴛ) are within 6” of the battlefield. The action is completed at the end of your turn.

objectives.name: Repair Teleport Homer
objectives.description:
[i]Progressive Objective[/i]
Score 5 victory points each time a unit from your army successfully completes the following action:

Repair Teleport Homer (Action): One ɪɴғᴀɴᴛʀʏ unit from your army can start to perform this action at the end of your Movement phase if it is wholly within your opponent’s deployment zone. The action is completed at the end of your next Command phase provided the unit attempting it is still wholly within your opponent’s deployment zone.

objectives.name: Raise the Banners High
objectives.description:
[i]Progressive and End Game Objective[/i]
If you select this objective, then units in your army can perform the following action:

Raise Banners (Action): One or more ɪɴғᴀɴᴛʀʏ units from your army can start to perform this action at the end of your Movement phase. Each unit from your army that starts to perform this action must be in range of a different objective marker that does not have one of your banners raised upon it (see below). A unit cannot start this action while there are any enemy units (excluding ᴀɪʀᴄʀᴀғᴛ) in range of the same objective marker. The action is completed at the end of your turn. If this action is successfully completed, that objective marker is said to have one of your army’s banners raised on it (the banner is ‘removed’ if your opponent controls the objective marker at the start of any phase). You score 1 victory point at the end of each of your Command phases, and 1 victory point at the end of the battle, for each objective marker on the battlefield that has one of your banners raised upon it.

objectives.name: Mental Interrogation
objectives.description:
[i]Progressive Objective[/i]
Score 3 victory points each time you successfully complete the following psychic action:

Mental Interrogation (Psychic Action - Warp Charge 4): One ᴘsʏᴋᴇʀ ᴄʜᴀʀᴀᴄᴛᴇʀ from your army can attempt to perform this psychic action in your Psychic phase if it is within 18” of an enemy Character models.

objectives.name: Psychic Ritual
objectives.description:
[i]End Game Objective[/i]
Score 15 victory points at the end of the battle if any unit from your army successfully completed the following psychic action 3 times during the battle:

Psychic Ritual (Psychic Action - Warp Charge 3): One ᴘsʏᴋᴇʀ ᴄʜᴀʀᴀᴄᴛᴇʀ unit from your army can attempt to perform this psychic action in your Psychic phase if it is within 6” of the centre of the battlefield.

objectives.name: Abhor the Witch
objectives.description:
[i]End Game Objective[/i]
You cannot select this secondary objective if your army includes any ᴘsʏᴋᴇʀ units. Score 5 victory points at the end of the battle for each enemy ᴘsʏᴋᴇʀ ᴄʜᴀʀᴀᴄᴛᴇʀ that is destroyed, and 3 victory points for every other enemy ᴘsʏᴋᴇʀ unit that is destroyed.
